review: We have a smart TV used mostly for watching Amazon and Netflix streaming, and the signal arrives via FIOS through an ethernet-connected router. Nevertheless, we have the occasional glitch in which the signal is dropped, and we usually have to turn off the TV and start from scratch to reconnect. Annoying! We bought the Fire TV Stick in hopes of avoiding this problem.So far--2 weeks--the Stick has performed reasonably well, although jumping from the TV remote to the Stick remote and vice-versa is inconvenient. And the black-on-black navigation ring and select button are impossible to see in a dimly lit room. One possible advantage of the Stick is that when we still have the occasional glitch, we don't lose the signal. Instead, the video stalls while the audio continues. After a matter of seconds, the video recovers and races until it catches up with the audio again. Disconcerting, but less inconvenient than having to turn off the TV.
